content:
Not sure who to ask about this - @Mark Kramer I notice your name on the ODH IG? @Grahame Grieve your name is on there too...

We have a few ballot comments telling us we should be using the ODH profiles in our IG (eICR). We said in our dispositions that we would do this if the ODH IG was published in time for us to include it when we were ready to publish.

As far as I can tell there isn't a published version of the ODH IG yet? I can only see a CI build (that hasn't been updated in a year) and the ballot site - also from a year ago. http://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/odh/history.cfml

Is it "legal" to include references to profiles that haven't been published? I couldnt' even find a validator.pack file though to use (I _think_ I would need that file to get the dependency to work?)

Need some advice on how to proceed with this...
I need to get the final version up on HL7. It has been completed
Do you have an ETA on when it will be through all the HL7 hoops?
Am I allowed to reference it before it has been published or would I have to wait?
We can't publish a guide that references something that isn't published as anything more than 'this is interesting'..''
I guess I'll leave both our occupation templates AND the references to ODH in our IG and see what happens by the time we are ready to publish in a couple of weeks...
And just remove the ODH stuff if it's not published in time.
the technical publication piece is pretty straight forward now - Lynn can do it in a couple of hours. The approval process.... not so much
Yeah, trust me, I am aware of that! :)
Well, the approval process for our IG is behind the ODH one, I think (seeing as I'm still making changes) so maybe it will work out.
BTW, I find it quite unfair that people voted NEG on our IG for not including the ODH profiles when they don't actually exist yet.
maybe we should have a hall of infamy
I know - I should be used to it by now - just seem to have spent a LOT of time dealing with ballot comments about ODH (both CDA and FHIR)... Had to vent!

@Mark Kramer any updates on when this will be published? Unless it's pretty soon it looks like we are going to have to use the simple Occupation History profile we originally created for the eCR IG as we can't reference non-published templates and we need start the publishing process in the next few weeks..
